pull_request.title: Allow nodes to have children attached

update.description:
Supersedes [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86)

Main changes:

* Moved the functions related to adding/removing/accessing children nodes from Visual classes to Node classes.
* Overrode `PreRender` for BaseNode so that it can call it on its children.
* Added a call to `PreRenderChildren` from Camera's `PreRender` so that children visuals will be updated.

There might be room for optimisation in this change: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457) but the cast was failing as in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71/revert-a-change-in-visual-to-fix-text/diff](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71/revert-a-change-in-visual-to-fix-text/diff)

Have only update Ogre so far but am happy for feedback on what’s there

pull_request.title: Allow nodes to have children attached

pullrequest.title: Allow nodes to have children attached

content.raw:
I made the modifications for Optix as well in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/df697407ad394198e17f05cdbede01d8e9cdfa92?at=default](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/df697407ad394198e17f05cdbede01d8e9cdfa92?at=default).  
I fixed another casting issue in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/686ab0276d40fc9791fdbd8d57e70a8aebcafe3d?at=default](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/686ab0276d40fc9791fdbd8d57e70a8aebcafe3d?at=default). I’m iterating backwards because I imagine that’s necessary since we’re removing elements, but it [was previously iterating forwards](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/66/support-iterating-through-storage-objects/diff#Linclude/ignition/rendering/base/BaseVisual.hhF282) so maybe not.

‌

@iche033 even if you don’t have time right now to review the code in detail, could you approve the general direction so that I know that [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/150/realtime-factor-display-plugin-attach-rtf/diff](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/150/realtime-factor-display-plugin-attach-rtf/diff) can go ahead without requiring additional modifications? That way I can get that PR reviewed and ready for merge once this dependency is approved.
content.html:
I made the modifications for Optix as well in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/df697407ad394198e17f05cdbede01d8e9cdfa92?at=default.
I fixed another casting issue in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/686ab0276d40fc9791fdbd8d57e70a8aebcafe3d?at=default. I’m iterating backwards because I imagine that’s necessary since we’re removing elements, but it was previously iterating forwards so maybe not.

‌

@iche033 even if you don’t have time right now to review the code in detail, could you approve the general direction so that I know that #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/150/realtime-factor-display-plugin-attach-rtf/diff can go ahead without requiring additional modifications? That way I can get that PR reviewed and ready for merge once this dependency is approved.

content.raw: yes, that sounds right. there’s a chance that if there are lots of nodes being connected together we will want the _equivalent_ of the performance improvements in BaseNode’s function, but for now we anticipate few nodes attached to non-visual nodes \(at the moment it will just be me, attaching a visual to a camera\), so we should be OK not using iterators. so then it sounds like it’s ok to leave the change in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457)
content.html: yes, that sounds right. there’s a chance that if there are lots of nodes being connected together we will want the equivalent of the performance improvements in BaseNode’s function, but for now we anticipate few nodes attached to non-visual nodes (at the moment it will just be me, attaching a visual to a camera), so we should be OK not using iterators. so then it sounds like it’s ok to leave the change in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457

content.raw: Oh! I misread my console. When it's in BaseVisual, `T=ignition::rendering::v0::OgreNode`,  and when it's in BaseNode, `T=ignition::rendering::v0::OgreObject`, so there is a difference.
content.html: Oh! I misread my console. When it's in BaseVisual, T=ignition::rendering::v0::OgreNode, and when it's in BaseNode, T=ignition::rendering::v0::OgreObject, so there is a difference.

pullrequest.title: Allow nodes to have children attached

content.raw:
What I don’t understand is why the code copied [from BaseVisual](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/26b02b5e6c0c6be33a49a94c74da974713050689/include/ignition/rendering/base/BaseVisual.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#BaseVisual.hh-514) for casting the children then behaves differently when moved to BaseNode, requiring [this change](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/6c1cb272286b1825e003038c3d6186b54bf5c457). In both cases `this->Children()` has type `ignition::rendering::v0::NodeStorePtr {aka std::shared_ptr<ignition::rendering::v0::Storeignition::rendering::v0::Node > }`.

I don’t want to undo the performance improvements from [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/66](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/66) by removing the iterator usage: @iche033 do you have any idea how we might be able to still use iterators there \(by fixing the cast\)? I know you looked into a similar issue for [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71).
content.html:
What I don’t understand is why the code copied from BaseVisual for casting the children then behaves differently when moved to BaseNode, requiring this change. In both cases this->Children() has type ignition::rendering::v0::NodeStorePtr {aka std::shared_ptr<ignition::rendering::v0::Storeignition::rendering::v0::Node > }.

I don’t want to undo the performance improvements from #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/66 by removing the iterator usage: @iche033 do you have any idea how we might be able to still use iterators there (by fixing the cast)? I know you looked into a similar issue for #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/71.
